subject: Critical Thinking
title: Red Herring: Changing the Subject
description: A quick win: understand Red Herring: Changing the Subject.

hook.text: 'Why did you miss the deadline?' 'Well, the whole project was poorly planned from the start.' The subject just changed.

buildup.text: Red herring: introducing an irrelevant topic to divert attention from the original issue.

discovery.text: The name comes from smoked herring, which was dragged across trails to mislead hunting dogs.

twist.text: Red herrings are powerful because the diversion is often interesting.

climax.text: Politicians are masters: 'What about your tax plan?' 'Let me tell you about my opponent's record on...' Redirect.

punchline.text: An interesting answer to the wrong question is still no answer.

quiz.question: What makes a red herring effective?
options: The diversion is interesting enough that people forget the original question
